results.title: Elements of surface hardening
results.creator_credit: F.E. Brooker, Audio Productions and United States. Office of Education
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Engineering heat treatment of steel”.
Shows how steel is pack and gas carburised; how a thin, hard case is obtained by cyaniding; how nitriding is used to obtain a very hard case; and how steel is flame and induction hardened.
results.creator_credit_for_label: F.E. Brooker, Audio Productions and United States. Office of Education

results.title: Elements of tempering, normalizing and annealing
results.creator_credit: F.E. Brooker, Audio Productions and United States. Office of Education
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Engineering heat treatment of steel”.
Shows how steel is tempered; how the structure, toughness and hardness of a plain carbon steel change at progressive tempering stages; how steel is normalised, by furnace heating and subsequent cooling in still air; how steel is annealed and how such an annealing process relieves stresses in steel castings and softens the metal.
results.creator_credit_for_label: F.E. Brooker, Audio Productions and United States. Office of Education

results.title: Elements of hardening
results.creator_credit: F.E. Brooker, Audio Productions, United States. Federal Security Agency and United States. Office of Education
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Engineering heat treatment of steel”.
Shows how steel is quench-hardened; how the structures and hardness of steels with different carbon content change at progressive quench-hardening stages; how an iron-carbon diagram is constructed and what information may be derived from an analysis of such a diagram.
results.creator_credit_for_label: F.E. Brooker, Audio Productions, United States. Federal Security Agency and United States. Office of Education

results.title: Trading
results.creator_credit: Alasdair Clayre, Nigel Houghton, Patrick Lui and Peter Montagnon
results.brief_description:
Episode number 12 of Series “Heart of the Dragon”.
This program is Part Twelve of a twelve episode documentary, The Heart of the Dragon. The documentary records what is actually happening in China today and it captures on film the lives of peasants, factory workers, Party officials, artists, scientists, and even millionaires.

results.title: Creating
results.creator_credit: Alasdair Clayre, Nigel Houghton, Patrick Lui and Peter Montagnon
results.brief_description:
Episode number 11 of Series “Heart of the Dragon”.
This program looks at the world of contemporary Chinese art, exploring the philosophic and historic influences that shape it. The way that Chinese artists pursue the essence of “reality” is examined as are the techniques which combine traditional values with unconventional materials to produce works that are resplendently Chinese.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Alasdair Clayre, Nigel Houghton, Patrick Lui and Peter Montagnon

results.title: Mediating
results.creator_credit: Alasdair Clayre, Nigel Houghton, Patrick Lui and Peter Montagnon
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “Heart of the Dragon”.
This program is about the breakdown of a marriage and the pressures that are brought on the couple to reconcile their differences. Highlights that, in China, society comes before the individual and the family must be maintained, whatever the cost.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Alasdair Clayre, Nigel Houghton, Patrick Lui and Peter Montagnon

results.title: Understanding
results.creator_credit: Alasdair Clayre, Nigel Houghton, Patrick Lui and Peter Montagnon
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “Heart of the Dragon”.
This program is Part Nine of a twelve episode documentary, The Heart of the Dragon. The documentary records what is actually happening in China today and it captures on film the lives of peasants, factory workers, Party officials, artists, scientists, and even millionaires.

results.title: Living
results.creator_credit: Alasdair Clayre, Nigel Houghton, Patrick Lui, Peter Montagnon and Mischa Scorer
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Heart of the Dragon”.
Over four fifths of China’s 1000 million inhabitants are peasants. This program visits a rural village to discover how they live. We follow the day to day life of a village family and focuses on the local Party secretary to depict the organisation of the village as a whole and the brigade and commune of which it is a part.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Alasdair Clayre, Nigel Houghton, Patrick Lui, Peter Montagnon and Mischa Scorer
